com.epoch.session

Class HWSession

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.epoch.session.HWSession
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EvalResultConstants, QuestionConstants, HWConstants, XMLConstants

    public class HWSession
extends Object
implements EvalResultConstants, HWConstants, QuestionConstants
    Corresponds to a homework session taken by the student, a preview of a question by an author, or a way to get information about a question, given its serial number in an assignment.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Map<Integer,Molecule[]> allQsRGroupMols
      R groups of each question in this assignment assigned to this student, hashed by question ID number, as molecules.
      private Map<Integer,String[]> allQsSubstns
      R groups of each question in this assignment assigned to this student, hashed by question ID number, as strings.
      private Assgt assgt
      Information about this assignment.
      private int currentIndex
      1-based serial number of the question being solved.
      private Date dueDate
      The due date and time of this assignment.
      private EvalResult[] evalResults
      Results of evaluation of this user's responses to the questions in this assignment; may also contain saved but not evaluated responses or initialized views of questions for this particular user.
      private Date firstEntry
      First time of entry into this assignment; used for timed assignments, acquired if necessary.
      private int hwId
      Unique (external) ID number of this assignment.
      private String ipAddr
      IP address of the user.
      private String[] origSubstns
      When doing an R group question in SIMILAR mode, stores the original R groups of the question.
      private Question[] questions
      Questions in this assignment.
      private Map<Integer,Integer> topicIdsByQIds
      Links from assignment questions to forum topics.
      private User user
      The user whose homework session this is.
      private String userId
      Login ID of the user doing this assignment.
      private boolean userIsInstructorOrTA
      Whether the user of this assignment is an instructor or a TA.
      private String[] userLangs
      Non-English languages of this user in order of preference.
      private String userName
      Name of the user doing this assignment; used only in exams.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HWSession

        public HWSession(User user,
                 Assgt hw,
                 boolean isTAOrCoinstructor,
                 String ipAddress,
                 boolean hideSynthCalcdProds)
          throws DBException,
                 NonExistentException
        Constructor called by homework/hwmain.jsp and submitUnsubmitted.jsp.
        Parameters:
        user - the user working this assignment
        hw - the assignment
        isTAOrCoinstructor - whether or not this user is a TA or a coinstructor
        ipAddress - IP address of the user
        hideSynthCalcdProds - whether to hide calculated synthesis products from the user in all assignments
        Throws:
        DBException - if the database can't be read
        NonExistentException - if there's no such assignment

                 boolean masterEdit)
          throws DBException,
                 NonExistentException

        Parameters:
        author - the question author
        question - question being previewed
        masterEdit - whether author is master author

        DBException - if the database can't be read
        NonExistentException - if there's no such assignment

      • debugPrint

        private static void debugPrint(Object... msg)

      • init

        private void init(int qId,
                  boolean fullLoad,
                  boolean lastOnly)
           throws DBException,
                  NonExistentException
        Code for loading a single question common to four constructors.
        Parameters:
        qId - unique ID number of the single question to obtain from the database
        fullLoad - full or super-light (qType, qFlags, question data only)
        lastOnly - when there's an assignment, whether to load the last response only or all responses
        Throws:
        DBException - if the database can't be read
        NonExistentException - if there's no such assignment

      • getResult

        public EvalResult getResult(int index)
                     throws ParameterException
        Get the information regarding how a student saw or responded to a Q.
        Parameters:
        index - 1-based serial number of Q in assignment
        Returns:
        result of evaluation of the last response, or the saved response, or the student's particular initialized view of the Q; null if unattempted and uninitialized; when called from showMol.jsp or resetConfirm.jsp, gets the result of evaluation of the nth attempt
        Throws:
        ParameterException - if the index is out of range

        public void setCurrentIndex(int index)
                     throws ParameterException

        Parameters:
        index - 1-based serial number of Q in assignment
        Throws:

      • getCurrentSubstns

        public String[] getCurrentSubstns()
                           throws DBException

        the R groups or variable values of this question, as Strings

        public Molecule[] getCurrentRGroupMols()

        For R-group Qs, gets the Molecule versions of the R groups.
        Returns:
        the R groups of this question, as Molecules
        Throws:
        DBException - if the database can't be read

      • generateNewSubstns

        public String[] generateNewSubstns()
                            throws DBException
        Generates a new set of R groups or variable values and stores them in the map.
        Returns:
        the new R groups or variable values of this question
        Throws:
        DBException - if the database can't be read

      • generateNewSubstns

        public String[] generateNewSubstns(boolean saveNewSubstns)
                            throws DBException
        Generates a new set of R groups or variable values and stores them in the map.
        Parameters:
        saveNewSubstns - whether to overwrite the question's current R groups or variable values with the new ones
        Returns:
        the new R groups or variable values of this question
        Throws:
        DBException - if the database can't be read or written to

      • writeSubstnsToDB

        private void writeSubstnsToDB(String[] substns)
        Writes substitutions (R groups or variable values) to database.
        Parameters:
        substns - the R groups to write

      • resetSubstns

        public String[][] resetSubstns()
                        throws DBException,
                               ParameterException
        Resets a Q's R groups to the originally assigned value after SIMILAR mode in answerframe.jsp.
        Returns:
        the old and new R groups for the question
        Throws:
        ParameterException - if the index is out of range
        DBException - if the database can't be read

      • resetSubstns

        public String[][] resetSubstns(int qNum)
                        throws DBException,
                               ParameterException
        Resets a Q's R groups to the originally assigned value after SIMILAR mode in answerframe.jsp.
        Parameters:
        qNum - 1-based index of the Q to reset
        Returns:
        the old and new R groups for the question
        Throws:
        ParameterException - if the index is out of range
        DBException - if the database can't be read

      • initializeStudentView

        public EvalResult initializeStudentView()
        Initializes a particular student's view of the question.
        Returns:
        an EvalResult with status set to INITIALIZED; for rank, fill in the blank, or multiple-choice, it also contains the initialized response string with options initialized; and for R group Qs, it also contains a colon-separated list of R groups

      • initializeStudentView

        public EvalResult initializeStudentView(boolean store,
                                        int mode)
        Initializes the order of options seen by a particular student in Choice, Rank, FillBlank, and ChooseExplain questions where options have been randomized.
        Parameters:
        store - whether to store the result of the initialization; will be false for PREVIEW, TEXTBOOK, or SIMILAR mode or for GRADEBOOK_VIEW mode if there's no evalResult already
        mode - PREVIEW, TEXTBOOK, SIMILAR, GRADEBOOK_VIEW, or SOLVE (when called from list.jsp)
        Returns:
        an EvalResult with status set to INITIALIZED and a response string with no options chosen or ranked, or null if something goes wrong with the initialization process

      • getInitializedString

        public String getInitializedString()
        For rank, fill in the blank, multiple-choice, and choose-and-explain Qs, creates a particular student's view of the question.
        Returns:
        a response with options initialized

      • reinstantiate

        public void reinstantiate(int replacedQNum)
        Replaces an existing question (and other questions in its bundle) with a new bundle in this instantiated assignment.
        Parameters:
        replacedQNum - 1-based position of the question in this assignment that is to be replaced

      • formatOK

        public boolean formatOK(String resp)
        Gets whether a response to a multiple-choice, fill-in-the-blank, rank, or choose-and-explain question is in a parsable format. Badly formatted responses to other question types will not cause Javascript errors.
        Parameters:
        resp - the response
        Returns:
        true if the response's format is parsable

      • submitResponse

        public EvalResult submitResponse(String response,
                                 int mode)
                          throws VerifyException,
                                 DBException
        A user has submitted a response to a question. Depending on the situation, take some of these actions: check for limits on response number, evaluate response, record the response, and log the response.
        Parameters:
        response - the response
        mode - SOLVE, PRACTICE, SIMILAR, PREVIEW, TEXTBOOK, VIEW, GRADEBOOK_VIEW
        Returns:
        the result of evaluating the response
        Throws:
        DBException - if the database can't be read or written to
        VerifyException - if the response isn't permitted

      • submitResponse

        public EvalResult submitResponse(String response,
                                 int mode,
                                 boolean evaluate)
                          throws VerifyException,
                                 DBException
        A user has submitted a response to a question. Depending on the situation, take some of these actions: check for limits on response number, evaluate response, record the response, and log the response.
        Parameters:
        response - the response
        mode - SOLVE, PRACTICE, SIMILAR, PREVIEW, TEXTBOOK, VIEW, GRADEBOOK_VIEW
        evaluate - whether to evaluate the response or just save it; default is true
        Returns:
        the result of evaluating the response
        Throws:
        DBException - if the database can't be read or written to
        VerifyException - if the response isn't permitted

      • submitResponse

        private void submitResponse(EvalResult evalResult)
                     throws DBException,
                            ResponseFormatException,
                            ResponseParseException
        Sends the response to be parsed or parsed and evaluated, monitoring it to make sure it doesn't take too long.
        Parameters:
        evalResult - contains the result of the evaluation instance of the question; may be null or empty
        Throws:
        DBException - if the database can't be read or written to
        ResponseFormatException - when the response format is incorrect
        ResponseParseException - when the synthesis or mechanism response cannot be parsed or the formula is malformed

      • logResponse

        private void logResponse(String response)
        Logs the response to disk.
        Parameters:
        response - the response

      • throwIfExcessReplies

        private void throwIfExcessReplies(EvalResult prevResult,
                                  String response)
                           throws VerifyException
        Checks to see if student has already submitted the maximum number of responses or has already submitted the correct response.
        Parameters:
        prevResult - the result from the previous response
        response - the current response
        Throws:
        VerifyException - if the student has already submitted the maximum number of responses or has already submitted the correct response

      • respDoesntCount

        private void respDoesntCount(EvalResult evalResult,
                             String[] userLangs)
        Makes a response not count as an attempt.
        Parameters:
        evalResult - the EvalResult that holds the number of tries and feedback
        userLangs - languages preferred by the user in order of preference

      • setResult

        public void setResult(EvalResult newResult,
                      boolean[] flags)
               throws DBException
        Overwrites the grade and number of tries of a student's response to a question. Called by gradebook/doReset.jsp and generateNewSubstns().
        Parameters:
        newResult - information to be stored
        flags - whether to rewrite the last response and its time, whether the record being modified is the most recent response, whether to preserve the R groups assigned to this student
        Throws:
        DBException - if the database can't be written to

      • isDueDatePast

        public final boolean isDueDatePast()
        Determines whether the assignment is past due, either because the due date is past, or because the exam is timed and the allowed time since first entry has been exceeded. If the assignment is an exam, returns to the database to retrieve the due date and extensions; otherwise, uses the values stored in this HWSession when it was initiated.
        Returns:
        whether the assignment is past due

      • getFirstEntry

        public final Date getFirstEntry()
        Gets the date of first entry into this assignment, retrieving it from the database if necessary.
        Returns:
        the date of first entry into this assignment

      • setFirstEntry

        private Date setFirstEntry()
                    throws DBException
        Sets the first entry into this assignment and stores it in the database. Shouldn't be necessary.
        Returns:
        the date and time of first entry
        Throws:
        DBException - if the database can't be written to
